messages.content:
You are tasked with adding English translations to a set of stakeholder quotes. For each quote:
- If the quote is in English, add "N.A." as the translation
- If the quote is in any other language, provide an accurate English translation

Input format is a markdown table with stakeholder names and quotes.
Output should be a markdown table with three columns: name, original quote, and translation.

IMPORTANT RULES:
- Never translate English quotes to English - use "N.A." instead.
- Only and always translate non-English quotes.
- If the original quote, in the third column of the md table is not in english, translate it and add the translation in the 4th column, as described below, but that is only when the quote is not in English.
- Keep original quotes exactly as they are.
- Maintain the markdown table format, without including any horizontal divider lines

Example input:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." |

Example output:
| Pierre Dupont | Consumer | "Cette décision est importante." | "This decision is important." |
| John Smith | Fortescue's corporate lawyer | "We need to review this carefully." | N.A. |

Example input:
| [Person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,eyc..)] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] |

Example output:
| [person Name 1] | Person Role 1 | [Original Quote in another language (e.g. Dutch, French, German, Spanish,etc..)] | [Translated Quote] |
| [person Name 2] | Person Role 2 | [Original Quote in English] | N.A. |

If the input is "None", return "None". if the original quote is not in English, make sure it is translated. Add "N.A" if the quote is already in English.

Input quotes:
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Australia's attitude to China during that period was puerile and was matched only by China's response. To get out of that awkward era as soon as possible is the responsibility for any good government." |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "You can't run around kicking your customers and still expect to sell a lot of boots." |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Causing fear and division or claiming you can run a business, let alone a country, without targets just says to me you've obviously never employed anyone, you've never created value from scratch." |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "The reason why we can drive potentially the next big economic wave, the biggest economic growth, the highest employment multiplier and economic multiplier in Australia's recent history is thanks to the necessity to address climate change." |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "I see this as a really key historical step to creating the next wave of major economic growth and employment for Australia." |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Now the last thing we want to do is start hurting that standard of living, hurting that economic growth, and a strong relationship between China and Australia is absolutely necessary to continue the growth of the economies of both countries." |

| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Australia's attitude to China during that period was puerile and was matched only by China's response. To get out of that awkward era as soon as possible is the responsibility for any good government." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "You can't run around kicking your customers and still expect to sell a lot of boots." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Causing fear and division or claiming you can run a business, let alone a country, without targets just says to me you've obviously never employed anyone, you've never created value from scratch." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "The reason why we can drive potentially the next big economic wave, the biggest economic growth, the highest employment multiplier and economic multiplier in Australia's recent history is thanks to the necessity to address climate change." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "I see this as a really key historical step to creating the next wave of major economic growth and employment for Australia." | N.A. |
| Andrew Forrest | Chairman of Fortescue | "Now the last thing we want to do is start hurting that standard of living, hurting that economic growth, and a strong relationship between China and Australia is absolutely necessary to continue the growth of the economies of both countries." | N.A. |
